meanings.definition: The qualities or characteristics of a knight.
meanings.sent1: His knightlinesses were evident in his bravery on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The knightlinesses of Sir Lancelot were admired by all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The knightlinesses of the young squire shone through as he helped an elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, his knightlinesses set him apart as a true leader.
meanings.sent5: The knightlinesses of the dragon-slayer inspired songs and tales for generations to come.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being chivalrous or honorable like a knight.
meanings.sent1: She aspired to reach the knightlinesses of her role model, Joan of Arc.
meanings.sent2: In times of trouble, his knightlinesses always shone through, helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: The knightlinesses of the young prince led him to defend the kingdom against the invading army.
meanings.sent4: Her knightlinesses was like a shining beacon of hope in a world filled with darkness.
meanings.sent5: The knightlinesses of the wise old knight guided the young squires in their training.
